newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street shares soft amid profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street shares soft amid profit-taking.

text.p: U.S. stocks drifted lower on Thursday morning, taking a pause after Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan's Humphrey-Hawkins testimony triggered sharp gains in financial markets.
The Dow Jones Industrial average was down 29 points at 8059 and the Nasdaq composite slid nine points to 1558.
"The market is seeing some profit-taking, mostly in the technology sector," Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments, said.
The long bond remained firm, gaining 6/32 to 6.42 percent.
Declines in Microsoft Corp helped push technology stocks lower, Cardillo said.
